name: Apple
description: A crisp and sweet fruit, often red or green, known for its versatility and health benefits.

name: Banana
description: A curved, yellow fruit with a soft texture and sweet taste, a great source of energy and potassium.

name: Orange
description: A citrus fruit with a tangy flavor, rich in vitamin C, and known for its refreshing juice.

name: Grapes
description: Small, juicy berries usually found in clusters, available in various colors, and used for making wine.

name: Strawberry
description: Small, red berries with a sweet taste, often used in desserts and known for their high vitamin C content.

name: Pineapple
description: Tropical fruit with a sweet and tart taste, often used in both savory and sweet dishes.

name: Mango
description: A juicy and flavorful tropical fruit with a sweet taste, often referred to as the "king of fruits.

name: Kiwi
description: Small, brown, fuzzy fruit with bright green flesh, packed with vitamin C and a unique flavor.

name: Peach
description: Soft and fuzzy-skinned fruit with a sweet and fragrant taste, commonly used in pies and jams.

name: Cherry
description: Small, round fruit with a red or purple color, known for its sweet and tart flavor.

name: Pear
description: Juicy and sweet fruit with a distinctive bell shape, available in various varieties.

name: Watermelon
description: A large, juicy fruit with red or pink flesh, perfect for hydrating due to its high water content.

name: Grapefruit
description: Citrus fruit with a sour to semi-sweet taste, known for its refreshing juice and health benefits.

name: Pomegranate
description: nique fruit with ruby-red seeds, known for its sweet and tangy taste and antioxidant properties.

name: Avocado
description: Creamy, green fruit with a buttery texture, rich in healthy fats, and often used in savory dishes.

name: Plum
description: Small, juicy fruit with a sweet or tart taste, available in various colors and often used in jams.

name: Raspberry
description: Small, red berries with a sweet and slightly tart flavor, commonly used in desserts and smoothies.

name: Blackberry
description: Dark purple berries with a sweet and juicy taste, often used in pies, jams, and desserts.

name: Cranberry
description: tart berries often used in juices, sauces, and as a Thanksgiving side dish.

name: Blueberry
description: blue-purple berries with a sweet taste, rich in antioxidants and commonly used in baking.

name: Apricot
description: range fruit with a sweet and slightly tart flavor, commonly used in jams and preserves.

name: Lemon
description: Citrus fruit with a sour taste, commonly used in cooking, baking, and beverages.

name: Cantaloupe
description: Sweet and aromatic melon with orange flesh, commonly eaten fresh or in fruit salads.

name: Honeydew
description: Sweet melon with pale green flesh and a mild flavor, commonly eaten fresh or in fruit salads.

name: Passion Fruit
description: Small, round fruit with a tough outer rind and aromatic, juicy pulp with a sweet-tart taste.

name: Pistachios
description: Pistachios (Pistacia vera) are edible seeds of the pistachio tree, originating from the Middle East.

name: Fig
description: Teardrop-shaped fruit with sweet, chewy flesh and a unique, mild flavor.

name: Guava
description: Tropical fruit with green or pink skin, sweet and fragrant flesh, commonly eaten fresh or in juices.

name: Lychee
description: translucent fruit with a sweet, floral flavor and a unique texture, commonly eaten fresh.

name: Papaya
description: Tropical fruit with orange flesh, sweet taste, and numerous black seeds in the center.

name: Coconut
description: Large seed with a hard, brown shell and white, edible flesh, used in both sweet and savory dishes.

name: Kiwi Berry
description: Small, green berries with a taste similar to kiwi, often eaten fresh or used in salads.

name: Star Fruit
description: Yellow, star-shaped fruit with a sweet and tart taste, commonly eaten fresh or in fruit salads.

name: Fuyu Persimmon
description: Orange fruit with a unique, sweet taste and a distinct astringency, can be eaten fresh or dried.

name: Raisins
description: Raisins are dried grapes, typically of the dark-colored varieties such as Thompson Seedless.

name: Elderberry
description: Dark purple berries with a tart taste, often used in syrups, jams, and as a supplement.

name: Gooseberry
description: Small, green berries with a tart taste, commonly used in pies, jams, and desserts.

name: Peach Palm
description: Orange fruit with a large seed, sweet taste, and fibrous texture, commonly used in cooking.

name: Salak
description: Brown, scaly-skinned fruit with sweet and tangy flesh, native to Indonesia.

name: Kumquat
description: Small, citrus fruit with a sweet skin and tart flesh, often eaten whole.

name: Mulberry
description: sweet berries with a dark color, commonly used in jams, desserts, and wines.

name: Rambutan
description: Exotic fruit with a hairy red or yellow skin and translucent, juicy flesh with a sweet taste.

name: Soursop
description: Large, spiky green fruit with white, fibrous flesh and a sweet and tangy taste.

name: Sapodilla
description: Brown, rough-skinned fruit with sweet and grainy flesh, often referred

name: Feijoa
description: Green fruit with a unique flavor combination of pineapple, guava, and strawberry.

name: Uvaia
description: Small, yellow fruit with a sweet and tangy taste, native to Brazil.

name: Pomelo
description: Largest citrus fruit with thick, green or yellow rind and sweet, mild flesh.

name: Acai Berry
description: The açaí palm, Euterpe oleracea, is a species of palm tree cultivated for its fruit, hearts of palm, leaves, and trunk wood.

name: Jackfruit
description: sThe jackfruit is the fruit of jack tree Artocarpus heterophyllus, a species of tree in the fig, mulberry, and breadfruit family

name: Blackcurrant
description: Blackcurrants (Ribes nigrum) have been called “the forbidden fruit” in the United States.

name: Redcurrant
description: The redcurrant or red currant (Ribes rubrum) is a member of the genus Ribes in the gooseberry family. It is native to western Europe.

name: Boysenberry
description: Boysenberries are larger and sweeter than blackberries, but comparable to them and raspberries in taste.

name: Kiwano
description: Kiwano, which is also called African horned cucumber or jelly melon,

name: Ackee
description: is a fruit of the Sapindaceae (soapberry) family, as are the lychee and the longan.

name: Date
description: Dates are a fruit cultivated from date palm (Phoenix dactylifera), a plant native to the Middle East and North Africa.

name: Chestnut
description: Chestnuts are the edible nuts produced by trees in the Castanea genus, such as the sweet chestnut (Castanea sativa).

name: Pineapple
description: Pineapple, perennial plant of the family Bromeliaceae and its edible fruit.

name: Mangosteen
description: Purple-skinned fruit with a white, segmented flesh and a sweet, tangy flavor.

name: Longan
description: Small, round fruit with a translucent white flesh and a sweet, musky flavor.

name: Loquat
description: Yellow-orange fruit with a sweet and slightly tangy flesh.

name: Lime
description: Green citrus fruit with a similar flavor to lemon, but smaller and more acidic.

name: Custard Apple
description: Green-skinned fruit with a sweet, creamy flesh and black seeds.

name: Durian
description: piky-skinned fruit with a strong, pungent odor and creamy flesh.

name: Cherimoya
description: Green-skinned fruit with creamy white flesh and a custard-like flavor.

name: Breadfruit
description: Large, starchy fruit with a bread-like texture, often boiled or roasted.

name: Olive
description: green fruit used for its oil and brine-cured as olives.

name: Ambarella
description: Ambarella is packed with beneficial antioxidants such as flavonoids, terpenoids and tannins.

name: Akebi
description: The fruit contains a sweet soft pulp resembling a white dragon fruit, eaten primarily in Japan as a seasonal delicacy.

name: Walnut
description: Walnuts (Juglans regia) are nuts derived from the walnut tree, native to the regions of Central Asia and southeastern Europe.

name: Ramphal
description: Ramphal belongs to the same family as Custard Apple, known as the Annona family.

name: Medlar
description: t is also highly regarded as a fruit that pairs well with almost any type of wine.

name: Quince
description: The fruit is a golden yellow pome and may be round and flattened or somewhat pear-shaped.

name: Nance
description: Nance fruit packs many important nutrients in a bite-sized package.

name: Nectarine
description: Nectarines are a sweet fruit, similar to peaches, except they grow without fuzz on their skin.

name: Naranjilla
description: Solanum quitoense, known as naranjilla in Ecuador, Costa Rica, and Panama and as lulo in Colombia,

name: Lucuma
description: Pouteria lucuma is a species of tree in the family Sapotaceae, cultivated for its fruit, the lúcuma.

name: Langsat
description: Lansium parasiticum, commonly known as langsat is a species of tree in the family Meliaceae with commercially cultivated edible fruits.

name: Jenipapo
description: Jenipapo has a strange flavour like a sweet, pungent, overripe fruit.

name: Jujube
description: Jujube fruit, also known as red or Chinese date, is native to Southern Asia but has become popular around the world.

name: Ice apple
description: Ice apple is a less known tropical fruit of the palmyra palm tree.

name: Egg Fruit
description: The Egg fruit is native to southern North America and northern Central America,

name: Hog plum
description: Hog plum, ornamental tree of the cashew family, grown for its edible fruits.

name: Horned melon
description: Its fruit has horn-like spines, hence the name horned melon.

name: Hazelnut
description: The hazelnut is the fruit of the hazel tree and therefore includes any of the nuts deriving from species of the genus Corylus,

name: Finger lime
description: Citrus australasica, the Australian finger lime or caviar lime, is a thorny understorey shrub or small tree .

name: Buddha’s hand
description: Well, it's true, and the fruit is called Buddha's hand citron.

name: Atemoya
description: Atemoyas are round or heart-shaped, averaging from 8 to 12 inches long; some can weigh up to 5 pounds.

name: Chayote
description: Chayote, also known as mirliton and choko, is an edible plant belonging to the gourd family, Cucurbitaceae.

name: Noni Fruit
description: Noni (Morinda citrifolia) is an evergreen tree with large leaves and yellow fruit.

name: Husk cherry
description: The fruit of many species are generically referred to as physalis, groundcherries, husk tomatoes, husk cherries, poha berries, and golden berries.

name: Cucumber
description: Cucumber fruits consist of 95% water (see nutrition table).

name: Tamarind
description: Sweet Tamarind Whole is a delightful fruit that has a ton of culinary and health benefits.

name: Prunes
description: A prune is a dried plum, most commonly from the European plum.

name: Damsons
description: Damsons, a subspecies of plums, is a small, dark purple fruit that grows wild in Great Britain, with a tart flavour more suitable to cooking.

name: Almonds
description: The almond is a species of small tree from the genus Prunus, cultivated worldwide for its seed,

name: Hawthorns
description: Hawthorn berries are tiny fruits that grow on trees and shrubs belonging to the Crataegus genus.

name: Arhat
description: Siraitia grosvenorii, also known as monk fruit, monkfruit or luohan guo, is a herbaceous perennial vine of the gourd family, Cucurbitaceae.

name: Babaco
description: The babaco, is a hybrid cultivar in the genus Vasconcellea from Ecuador.

name: Strawberry
description: Strawberry,also known as Kaszëbskô malëna,are strawberries of the Elsanta variety.

name: Deglet Nour
description: Native to Algeria, deglet nour is one of the most common date varieties consumed in the entire North African region.

name: Sour Cherry
description: Sour cherries are smaller than sweet cherry varietals and have a round to oval, plump appearance, attached to slender, elongated, and fibrous green stems.

name: Jabuticaba
description: Jabuticaba are traditional Brazilian berries native to the states of Minas Gerais, Goiás, and São Paolo.

name: Goumi
description: Goumi fruit  is a small, tart, and nutrient-rich red berry, often used in jams and jellies, and is cultivated for its ornamental and edible qualities.

name: Batuan
description: Batuan (is a tropical fruit native to Southeast Asia, recognized for its sour flavor .

name: Beechnut
description: Beechnut refers to the small, triangular nuts produced by the beech tree .

name: Biriba
description: Biriba  is a tropical fruit native to the Amazon rainforest,

name: Carob
description: Carob refers to the leguminous pod of the Ceratonia siliqua tree, native to the Mediterranean region.

name: Genip
description: Genip, also known as mamoncillo or Spanish lime, refers to the fruit of the Melicoccus bijugatus tree.

name: Velvet Apple
description: Velvet Apple also known as Mabolo or Butter Fruit, is a tropical fruit with velvety, brown skin and sweet,

name: Kaffir Lime
description: Kaffir lime is a citrus fruit known for its bumpy, dark green, double-lobed leaves that are often used in culinary dishes.

name: Curry Berry
description: Curry berries, botanically classified as Murraya koenigii, are the fruits of an evergreen tree belonging to the Rutaceae or citrus family.

name: Cloudberry
description: Cloudberry  is a small, amber-colored berry native to cold and arctic regions of the Northern Hemisphere.

name: Pomegranates
description: Pomegranates are vibrant, red fruits with a tough outer rind and a crown-like calyx.

name: Prickly pears
description: Prickly pears, also known as cactus fruit or tunas, are the fruit of various species of Opuntia cacti.

name: Rose apples
description: Rose apples, also known as Syzygium jambos, are tropical fruits with a waxy, bell-shaped appearance and a distinct rosy aroma.

name: Mammea Americana
description: Mammee, also known as mammee apple or Mamey (Mammea americana), is a tropical fruit tree native to the Caribbean and Central America.

name: Pumpkin
description: Pumpkin is a versatile, orange-fleshed winter squash that is widely cultivated and consumed worldwide.

name: Black Sapote
description: For just about any other fruit, a brown or black interior indicates that the fruit is past its best, but that’s not true for the black sapote.

name: Cucamelon
description: Cucamelons are incredibly cute tiny fruit that look like baby watermelons from the outside.

name: Gac Fruit
description: From the outside, gac does kind of look like a baby jackfruit, but visual appearance is where the similarity ends.

name: Cempedak
description: The cempedak is a close relative of the jackfruit, and interior structure of the two fruits is similar.

name: Monstera Deliciosa
description: Monstera deliciosa is another tropical fruit, although this one looks a lot more like an ear of corn than it looks like a fruit.

name: Santol
description: Santol fruits are round to oval, averaging 4 to 7 centimeters in diameter, and have a slightly flattened shape.

name: Yangmei
description: The yangmei fruit is extremely common in China and is frequently eaten raw and used in creating alcoholic drinks.

name: Wood Apple
description: The wood apple seems to get its name from the very hard rind of the fruit.

name: Water Apple
description: This apple is named Water Apple because of the amount of water present in this fruit. This fruit is found in many colors and forms. It is mildly sweet in taste and full of water. Consuming this removes the lack of water in the body.

name: Nipah Seeds
description: Nipah seeds come from the nipah palm.

name: Bacuri
description: Inside the bakuri is a white pulp containing about three to five seeds. Jaggery seeds are dense all around and give a sweet and sour taste

name: Miracle Fruit
description: This unusual berry is significant because glycoproteins within it bind to the taste buds on the tongue.

name: Natal Plum
description: The natal plum is a particularly delicious fruit, yet the plant is from a highly deadly family, which makes people steer well clear of it.

name: Honeyberry
description: Honeyberry plants produce these unusual elongated blue berries that look almost like someone has taken a blueberry and stretched it out.

name: Barrel Cactus
description: That looks dangerous. But those are often the most delicious.

name: Saguaro
description: Saguaro is a cactus species that is particularly common in Arizona, although it is also found in other parts of the United States and further afield.

name: Cupuacu
description: Cupuacu comes from the same family as cocoa and is commonly used to create a new kind of ‘chocolate’,

name: Pepino Melon
description: Despite its appearance and name, pepino melon isn’t actually a melon.

name: Pandanus
description: The screw pine tree is a particularly common type of tree in many Pacific coastal regions.

name: Jocote
description: This fruit is most often called Jacote or Spanish plum. Although, like most fruits on this list, it has a host of names.

name: Araza
description: Araza is a rare fruit that comes from some parts of Peru and Brazil.

name: White Sapote
description: Now here’s a white one. Both fruits look similar from the outside, although the color of their flesh is quite different.

name: Balata
description: Balata fruit can be found in the Caribbean, in South America, and in Central America, but remains a rare fruit.

name: Marang
description: This fruit might look familiar, as it’s essentially a cross between jackfruit and durian.

name: Granadilla
description: You’ll often see these sweet fruits called passion fruit. That’s not surprising, as there are plenty of similarities and the two are closely related.

name: Rattan Fruit
description: Rattan fruit sometimes goes by the name snake fruit as well, but it has larger scales and isn’t as prickly as the salak.

name: Nyii Fruit
description: These small oval fruits also go by the name bird plum. They have slightly wrinkled brown skin, making them look a little like dates.

name: Governor’s Plum
description: The governor’s plum fruits are indeed much like European plums, complete with a dark purple to black coloring and familiar texture.

name: Dalandan
description: Dalandans are treated much like regular oranges, so they can be eaten raw, juiced, or segmented and used in fruit salads.

name: Sugarcane
description: Sugarcane  is a tall, perennial grass known for its thick, jointed stalks containing high concentrations of sucrose.

name: Dragon fruit
description: Dragon fruit, also known as pitaya or pitahaya, refers to the vibrant and exotic fruit of various cactus species in the genera Hylocereus and Selenicereus.

name: Bush Cherry
description: Bush cherry typically refers to various species of cherry shrubs or small cherry trees belonging to the genus Prunus.
